intro: Polygala venulosa, commonly known as the slender milk-vetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, bean-like pods that contain seeds. Polygala venulosa is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
